description:
Q: What's more awesome than a dance party in the desrt?


A: A scavenger hunt desert dance party! 




Wait... what is a scavenger hunt dance party you ask? It's real simple! At random points during the dance party we'll pick a category like snowboard goggles. You'll then have to find a burner walking around with snowboard goggles and bring them to the dance party to score points before we move onto the next category. If you get them to join your team, you'll score an additional point per round until they leave. There is even a rumor going around that there could be secret bonus rounds! Teams of any size welcome! Outpost 23 DJs will be throwing down 90s, one-hit wonders and mash up to celebrate the occasion.
title: 1st Annual Outpost23 Scavenger Hunt Dance Party
print_description: 1st Annual Outpost23 Scavenger Hunt Dance Party

description:
1worldcurrency camp hosts the Granary Receipt Project. A financial revolution and Jubilee. Be gone fiat currency and usury and hello pure money and abundance. Coconut currency anyone? John Frum?

Learn the secret lost in the Garden of Eden that money grows on trees. It is the secret hidden from us by the serpent viper money changers. Learn how to destroy all fiat currency and turn it into gods money. Time, technology and resource based currencies.

Learn how you can convert your fiat currency into food based currency thus returning the fiat to the bankers who printed it and leaving you with an actual valuable commodity to spend into the economy.

Its simple you purchase a bag of grain from a local producer only they agree to store it for you and you get the receipt to trade for other goods or services. Now you have a pure resource based currency. It has more intrinsic value than fiat as it can be eaten. 

The receipt for the goods must be claimed by a certain date to be valid as the product has a shelf life and the grower storing the grain has to pay for storage. The receipt has the value of the grain paid in dollars and denotes the weight the receipt is good for.
The receipt can be traded for the fiat currency value or the weight value.

In this way any agricultural community can regain control of their money supply.

May peace be with you,
Joshua
title: 1worldcurrency Money Grows On Trees
print_description: 1worldcurrency camp hosts the Granary Receipt Project. A financial revolution and Jubliee.

description:
HEALTH PERMIT INFO

You must apply for a health permit & be inspected if:

*You will be cooking/serving food to large groups of more than 125 CAMPERS consistently.

(If you have a communal kitchen shared by 125 or more but meals are prepared individually or in smaller quantities for < 125 persons a permit is not required but we highly recommend 
you research and review food safety starting with the NSHD information).

*You wish to share, cook or serve food or non-alcoholic beverages to the general Burning Man population (gifting food).

Permit procedures & deadlines:

If you have already applied for a permit you should be receiving instructions in the mail.

If you are planning to give away food/drinks to the public on the playa including fresh squeezed juice, coffee with dairy or even snow cones you need a permit.

Here's the scoop from Cindy Ulch Supervisor with the NSHD 
Environmental Health Program:

The only application any camp needs is the "Food Permit Application 
for Burning Man" found here:

http://health.nv.gov/BFHS_EHS.htm

Find the flame icon at the bottom of the website for this application and other food safety info.

DEADLINES:

Via Mail:
Received no later than FRIDAY AUG.16th in Ellen Kunz's office at:
NSHD 
475 West Haskell Street Suite 38, 
Winnemucca, NV 89445.

In person: 

No later than THURSDAY AUG.22nd-
4150 Technology Way Suite 100, Carson City, NV. or 475 West Haskell Street Suite 38 Winnemucca, NV. 
 
On the application the event coordinator is "Burning Man". Include 
USD payment.

Pick up permits at Playa Info during the following days & hours:
 
Sunday Aug. 25th - Friday Aug. 30th from 1:00PM to 2:30PM
 
We do this to get an accurate camp location from which to do inspections. WE are NOT issuing new permits at Playa Info.
IMPORTANT:IN THE PAST, CAMPS DID NOT COMPLETE THE PERMIT PROCESS BY PICKING UP THEIR PERMIT.DON'T BE SHUT DOWN, PICK UP YOUR PERMIT.
QUESTIONS:775-623-6588 or email above
title: 2013 Health Department Food Permit Pick-Up
print_description: Health Permit pick-up at Play Info from 1-2:30 p.m. from Sunday, August 25 to Friday, August 30.

description:
You must apply for a health permit & be inspected if:

*You will be cooking/serving food to groups of more than 125 CAMPERS on a consistent basis.

(If you have a communal kitchen shared by >125 or more but meals are prepared individually or in smaller quantities for <125 persons a permit is not required but we recommend you research and review food safety starting with the NSHD info).

*You wish to share,cook or serve food or non-alcoholic beverages to the general population (gifting food).

Permit procedures & deadlines:

If you have already applied for a permit you should receive instructions in the mail.

If you are planning to gift food/drinks to the public on the playa including fresh squeezed juice, coffee with 
dairy or even snow cones you need a permit.

Here's the scoop from Cindy Ulch, Supervisor with the NSHD Environmental Health Program:

The only application any camp needs is the "Food Permit Application for Burning Man" found here:

http://health.nv.gov/BFHS_EHS.htm

Find the flame icon at the bottom of the website for the application & food safety information.

DEADLINES:

Via Mail:
MUST BE received no later than FRI. AUG.16th in Ellen Kunz's office at:
NSHD 475 West Haskell Street Ste 38, 
Winnemucca, NV 89445.

In person: 

No later than THUR. AUG.22nd - 4150 Technology Way Ste 100, Carson City, NV. or 475 West Haskell Street 
Ste 38 Winnemucca, NV. 
 
On the application, the event coordinator is "Burning Man". Include 
USD payment.

Pick up permits at Playa Info in Center Camp during the following days & hours:
 
Sun. Aug. 25th to Fri. Aug. 30th from 1:00PM to 2:30PM
 
 We do this to get an accurate camp location from which to do inspections. WE are NOT issuing new permits at Playa Info.
 
 IMPORTANT: LAST YEAR SOME CAMPS DID NOT COMPLETE THE PERMIT PROCESS BY GETTING THEIR PERMIT AT PLAYA INFO & BEING INSPECTED.DON'T BE SHUT DOWN.PICK UP YOUR PERMIT & BE INSPECTED.
QUESTIONS:call(775)623-6588 OR email
title: 2013 HEALTH DEPARTMENT PERMITS - DEADLINES

description:
Please join your fellow Nevada Burners for an unregulated, very distinguished, and completely lawful group photo and booze in Black Rock City at 4pm SHARP on Thursday, August 29, at The Man (6:00 side).  

Come as you are and please bring all your fellow Nevada Burner kin, from whatever cranny or dimension of the cosmos they originally sprouted from.

The group photo will be freely available to download following the Burning Man, and you can still see the photos of previous years, all here:

http://tinyurl.com/nevadaburnersphotos

_____________

Wanted: Nevada Burners. No Foreigners.
What: The Fourth Lawful Group Portrait
Where: Black Rock City. The Man. 6:00 side
When: Thursday, August 29, at 4:00 pm SHARP
When: Don't be fucking late!
Why:  We can cult too, hippies.
title: 2013 Nevada Burners Photo Shoot
print_description: Nevada Burners unite for an unregulated, very distinguished, and completely lawful group photo at the Man (6:00 side) at 4pm -- don't be fucking late!

description:
Begin at 3:15 AM on August 1st or any day after. Continue each day until August 31. The idea is to write in a hypnogogic/hypnopompic (between sleeps) state of altered consciousness.
    You may write any length, style, form, content, voice, rhythm, etc.
    DO NOT EDIT your work. This is raw stuff, baby. That's part of the experiment. You are welcome to edit, collage, break apart the poems later for whatever purpose you choose, but please SHARE THE RAW STUFF with the rest of the group here or on the website once the experiment is over.
    (Optional) Do not read what you have written until the month is over, except to skim the work to make sure everything is legible.

HOWEVER: if you'd like to come by Art Predator's camp to share, please do! 

September 1: Transcribe your scribbles. (Don't edit!!)

Submit raw work to the 3:15 website on your own page. See what others have written in 2013 or previous years.
title: 3:15 Experiment
print_description: It's the 20th anniversary of the 3:15 Experiment! Write at 3:15am any/all nights in August to join this altered states of consciousness writing ritual

description:
A 333 Peace Windsinger Band, will play their Windsinger instruments (Windsinger.org), sending a message out to our Space Brothers & Sisters, as we perform John Williams score, "Close Encounters of the 3rd Kind" (or Close Encounters of the Frum Kind). We will start to gather at 11pm after the regional burn and begin the performance at 11:59pm Thur 8-29, creating the first Midnight Mass Windphony, ever in the history of humankind! 

The plan is to create a human / color-light & sound vibrational bridge connecting the Man, the Temple and Way Beyond (what ever that means for you) through a vibrational alignment of individual players. We are inviting conscious hoopers, fire dancers and any other  "instruments of mass creation" to sync up with this vibrational field of PEACE & LOVE. This is the only pre-requisite for BAND Members, as we open a "Quantum Portal" bridging our highest potential, creating a "morphogenic field," reaching inter-dimensionally through time and space, connecting all those attuned to this vibrational field.

Come and Play...even if you are not on the Playa, join us on a vibrational level...and if you do make it, ONLY COME IF YOU CAN HOLD A POSITIVE THOUGHT OF LOVE AND PEACE! We will create a cosmic "string of pearls" that will produce a universal ripple...reaching Eternity ItSelf! This IS Cult Cargo at its finest, with only our highest and best intentions in mind, as we collectively "reach out and touch some ONES..." And if the time and space permits...maybe, just maybe, the recipients of our Mass Windphony will come and  join us in this 3rd dimensional reality... with the veils already thinned  through the very spirit of Burning man...anything is possible! 

Come Play in the Band and help create this cosmic wave...

Register at https://www.facebook.com/windsingerX and if you want to be part of the Windphony. Bring a Windsinger, or let us know if you want to own an instrument of your own, as part of our non-profit Windsinger Xperience!
title: 333 Peace Midnight Mass Windphony
print_description: 333 Peace Windsinger Band will perform Thurs 11:59pm "Close Encounters of the 3rd Kind" Midnight Mass Windphony connecting the Man, Temple & Beyond...

description: We start the afternoon at about 1pm sharing our Sangria concoction and we break out the chips and salsa. We relax and drink and enjoy the amazing company of new friends and playa family. If you want to participate...bring a fun costume/burning man outfit. We throw your name into a hat and whoever you pick you get to dress in your crazy outfit. Then we do a backwards parade to the Distrikt and dance until we are ready to get back to our camps to get ready to watch the man burn.  It's always so much fun and this year we are inviting anyone who wants to join us in the fun!

print_description: Sangria Party on 8/31 starting @ 1pm, Costume exchange @ 4pm and Backwards Parade @ 5pm. Be @ 9:15 or 9:45ish and H for all of the fun! Salsa contest.

description:
"Calling all of you facially hirsute throwbacks out there, gather 
up and deliver your fine self, along with your inner and outer 
beards to the House of the Automatic Subconscious, where we shall take the time to parade you before us like so much hairy meat and pass judgment upon those locks and curls that cascade off of the area known as your chinny-chin-chin. There will be 4 prime categories: Full-Beard, Moustache, Freestyle Full Beard, Fake Beard and quite probably not possibly, an 'Other' category.

As per usual in this sort of event, our highly esteemed panel of 
untrained professionals will judge upon such features as glossiness 
of pelt, lack of nits, creativity, fullness of body, amount of previous 
dinner ensconced within and other equally tangible parameters that attest to the care and feeding of your personal face troll. Bribery and foolishness are considered de rigueur.

All that is necessary is that you have some form of facial hair, a 
good and jolly spirit, and the necessary accoutrement of a cummerbund. One must have the proper air of formality around such an event as this, do not you agree?"
title: 4th Annual Mr. Beard Rock City
print_description: All ye razor-challenged and hidden of face, come display your fine hirsuteness at the 4th evah Mr. Beard Rock City Beautiful Hairy Beast Competition.

description: Burning Man is about mind blowing experiences. Send yours on a substance free trip, expand your consciousness without any aids, add new perspectives to your world. Come to 9 Energies to learn how to activate your Superpower at will. Learn about the 9 Active Energies - which one is your Superpower and how do you activate it? The human journey encompasses connection to source, others, soul and self and once in connection to transformation - where are we, what is most alive, what is possible, how do we actually do that and how do we do it without force together. description:
Like to sing? Come to our vocal jam. Last year, we had a blast when a  
spontaneous chorus broke out in our camp, covering classic harmony-rich songs like Billy Joel's "For the Longest Time," and a tradition  
was born. We will gather and sing popular, well-known, or timeless  
songs in harmony (e.g., folk, pop, rock, opera, blues, barbershop, and  
on and on), without accompaniment (i.e., a capella). Song (lyric) sheets will be provided. All are welcome - no training needed.
title: A Capella Chorus Jam

description:
Look for our White Tower and tent and you'll find that We have what you need,
 some chilly snow in the desert!
	Every Afternoon Monday through Friday, from 1-3 you can come by our cool shade tent and chill out with a snow cone made just for you in the many flavors of Our choice. You may have any of the flavors we decide to give you, while the ice lasts.

	Over heated Kids may cut the line,(with Mom/Dad), and may ask for a Cone anytime in the day if they need it, providing we can find the ice for them.

	Need we say more?
No, But we can.
	We strive for the best and finest shaved ice snow to blend with the flavors and encapsulate them it a tasty cooling treat. We don't do Chunky snow!  There is a difference, and you'll know it as soon as your frozen treat melts gently on your Tongue releasing the sweet and/or sour bouquet to your waiting taste buds, refreshing you and cooling you while you enjoy the Art and other activities available in our camp. 
	Bring a new clean block of ice and you'll make friends for life and maybe get an extra treat too!
We do not do snow cups, or Bottles, because they are not a Snow Cone and there is a Difference!
title: Afternoon SnowCones at Contraptionists
print_description:
Try any flavor we decide for you.
Need we say more?
Mon-sat 1-3 in our cool shade tent.
Hot Kids may cut in or ask for one anytime if there's ice

description: As the hot coals of the Man burn cool from white and red to black and grey, adult Gay, Bi & Curious men of the Playa head to Down Low Club @ 7:15 GDP to enjoy one last night of über hot man-to-man action. After being open 24/7 all week, our discreet, enclosed, air-conditioned, away-from-home and away-from-prying eyes manplay tent celebrates all things adult male until dawn with this last of our themed events for Burning Man 2013. As we close another testosterone-fueled year on the Playa this last night at Down Low Club is yours to live, men! Still curious? Fantasies yet to live? Don't go home without checking it out. Remember, what happens at Burning Man stays at Burning Man.

description: ALIA can take a room into deep ecstasy with her bright energy and serpentine movements drawing from her training as a dance performer and her devotion to embodying the feminine, never playing anything that she herself won't move to. She has had a life-long love affair with music and dance - they are her spiritual practice and her most potent passions. ALIA transmits the bliss she experiences in performances to create a connected, alive and activated experience that evokes the sacred and awakens our connection to our source through rhythm and movement. She approaches every set as a ritual and as a facilitator of dance floor unity. ALIA has shared the stage with the likes of Beats Antique, Random Rab, Govinda, Freq Nasty, Marty Party, An-ten-nae, Heyoka, Pussymonster, Sasha Rose, Vibesquad, DJ Jocelyn, and Bay Area favorite DJ Dragonfly. On Soundcloud at www.soundcloud.com/aliarhythms On YouTube at www.youtube.com/aliarhythms On Twitter at www.twitter.com/alia_rhythms

print_description: Special guest ALIA is back at RhythmWave to take you to deep ecstasy with her bright energy and serpentine movements.

description:
Men are terrified/traumatized and this is stressful.  We are overwhelmed and we are trained to think we are on our own and that we have to fix it ourselves. We developed coping mechanisms to help us deal with these scary thoughts.  We fight for control of the universe. 

Women are terrified/traumatized and this is stressful.  We are overwhelmed and we are trained to think we aren't capable of fixing it ourselves.  We developed coping mechanisms to help us deal with these scary thoughts. We withdraw and don't try and wait for someone else to figure it out.  

The fact is we are all living based on a lie.  

Men, we can't fix it, we can't do it alone and our coping mechanisms aren't working.

Women, we are an essential part of the solution - no one can fix it for us or without us and our coping mechanisms aren't working.

This is the truth and it's beautiful in it's simplicity and elegant in solution.

We need each other.

So you see, the Truth is Beauty

So let's do it consciously, together.  

And let's start now at Burning Man...

For our daughters, our sons, ourselves we are inviting all of you, everyone, to a group hug:  11 pm at Truth is Beauty after the Core Burn. We hope to see you there.
title: A New Beginning
print_description: For our daughters, our sons, ourselves, join the artist and crew at Truth is Beauty at 11 pm for a group hug...Visit her before to find out more!

description:
Welcome to the best little party on the playa! Apres ski is back for 2013! Same Wednesday night and same area as years past. 
Come Party in the SNOW storm! We have fake snow so wear your old-skool ski gear, toques,goggles, anything winter-sport related! That includes Luge lycra outfits! We will be serving up unique wintery themed drinks so make sure you saddle up to the bar with some friends and have a 5 person shot with the shot-ski! 5 shot glasses stuck to a ski which when tipped back always gets a little messy for the ill timed rookie!

And the main reason we put all this effort into doing this is to bring back the best music on the playa! The undisputed Queen of Après ski music, Foxy Moron willl once again be rounding up the most nuclear, the most funkulear, the most rump crunkulear DJ's on the playa! Can't tell you who till closer to the date!
Ski you August 28th on the playa! First person to show up wearing COLD WET acid wash jeans and an old Ocean Pacific or K-way jacket gets a mickey of Fireball!!
title: Après Ski Party
print_description: Ski themed party with old skool tunes from Foxy Moron and friends. Fresh snow for the ski bunnies and shot-ski racers. Wear your sexy retro ski gear!

description: As John Frum said, “Let there be ART!” this year consider finding out more about the fantastic art projects at Burning Man! This informal bike tour is hosted by volunteers from the ARTery (6:25 & Esplanade). A curated group of art projects will be visited and discussed. This tour will begin at 10:00 AM and run approximately 60-90 minutes. The tours are flexible so feel free to join us on playa if you see a bunch of bikes traveling in a pack, or drop out if you want. The tour starts promptly at the bike racks across from the ARTery (on the Esplanade). Note that there are also ART TOUR - Guided Tour (search Playa Events), and self guided tours (paper copies) available at the ARTery. Most of the art on the playa is self-funded, so be sure to check out your favorite art projects on the Burning Man website now, and then help fund them or volunteer through their respective websites. It takes every single one of us to make Burning Man happen...
title: ART TOUR - Bicycles
print_description: ARTery curated bike tour of art projects.  Meet in front of ARTery. Whiteout permitting.

description: It's all about the ART projects and the fabulous ARTISTS and their teams who create them! Ride in style on a bus/mutant vehicle as volunteers from the ARTery provide information on curated art pieces, as well as the Temple and The Man. Guided Vehicle tours run Tue-Fri and begin at 11:00 AM at Everywhere. Vehicle tours are meant for people with mobility issues -- seniors, pregnant women, people with ongoing or temporary disabilities, children, and others who might face challenges in getting out and around the playa. You must have tickets in advance to get a seat on the bus. Tickets are available @ noon THE DAY BEFORE a Everywhere (6:22 & Esplanade). Also note that there are separate ART TOUR - Bicycles (search Playa Directory), as well as self-guided (paper) tours available at the ARTery (on Esplanade)
title: ART TOUR - Guided Tour
print_description: ARTery curated tour art projects via mutant vehicles.  Preference for those w/ mobility challenges.  Get tix DAY BEFORE @Noon@ Everywhere (6:22 & Esp)

description:
Artist: Cynthia Fleischmann-www.Bodypaintography.com
What: Participate in an ‘Artistic Happening’ where you will be invited to strip naked, cover yourself in Playa dust with painted cracks and red hands to simulate a connection with yourself in your purest form, the environment and each other. The purpose is to bring us back to our most natural state of being, with the desert environment and red hands symbolizing life and death, love and hate. The more participants the better, helping to create a unifying and liberating experience which will be documented with photography and film, to be posted on the website Bodypaintography.com. Look for flags with Red Hands and buckets that need help filling! Lets make this gathering impressive and expressive together! Don’t forget to bring water for hydration.
When: The happening takes place 3pm dusting preparation, 5 pm documenting the outcome.
Where:  Meet near the Temple…look for the flags with Red Hands!
title: 'Ashes to Ashes: Dust to Dust' Artistic Happening

located_at_art.name: Ashes to Ashes; Dust to Dust

print_description: Art Gathering: Nudity, Playa dust, painted cracks and red hands will be combined to form connections with yourself, the environment and each other!

description: The bigger the 'Artistic Happening' the better! One with ourselves, the environment and eachother!
title: 'Ashes to Ashes; Dust to Dust' Volunteers Meeting

description: This is a workshop focused on the current skies from a Western Astrology perspective. The biggest news is the ongoing Uranus - Pluto square, which is coming up again in early November. The revolutionary and evolutionary symbolism of this collision of outer planet energies is evidenced all around us, for both the society in general and for individuals. It represents in fact the hallmark of the sixties, when they were last in major aspect; then they were conjunct. Coincidentally - not! - the first exact hit if this current square was last year, in 2012... we have been seeing increasing signs of the return of sixties idealism and sexual freedom, women's empowerment, folks out in the streets to protest an establishment that has truly run amok, and on and on... this important outer planet aspect in fact colors this entire decade that I like to call the "turbulent teens..." Planned to be an hour-long discussion/talk with plenty of time for questions...
title: Astrology of 2013 and Beyond
print_description: This workshop focuses on the current skies from a Western Astrology perspective. An hour-long discussion/talk with plenty of time for questions.

description:
The BAAAHS (Big-Ass Amazing Awesome Homosexual Sheep) will invade Celestial Bodies (7:30 Plaza)
BAAAHS is part penetrable large-scale sculpture, part mutant vehicle, part socio-political statement, and part gay disco.
From head to tail the art car will be 40-feet long and two levels. He will be a cuddly sheep on the outside with a chill den on the inside. The only entrance will be through his rear end. 
His party side (the port or driver side) will contain a large sound system and a DJ platform, hidden by his fluffy exterior. His business side (the starboard or passenger side) houses generators, ventilation, passage between levels, and the exit. From all directions, he looks like a big adorable huggable sheep roaming the pastures of the Playa.
title: BAAAHS Invasion
print_description: The BAAAHS (Big-Ass Amazing Awesome Homosexual Sheep) will invade Celestial Bodies (7:30 Plaza)

description:
Yep, this really is what you think it is - a "mouth-on" workshop where we'll have a chance to ask questions, compare notes, share techniques, and generally learn from each other to be more skillful at this thing we love - or want to love - to do.  If you're interested in learning more about how to please your man orally, this is the place for you.

Come on ladies / givers, you know you've got some skills - and some questions!  Come share your favorite tips and techniques by words and demonstration, and ask questions that have been plaguing you.

	* Drool or dry? 
	* What about the gag reflex?
	* How do you use hands and still go deep?

And guys, you must have comments you'd like to pass on, other than simply "Yes, please"!

	* Hate teeth?  Want teeth?
	* What about deep throat?

Here's your chance to make your requests - and pet peeves - heard!

This is a participatory event open to couples of any combination, so long as one of them has some phallic protuberance and the other is applying lips, tongue, and maybe even throat to it.  No lookie-loos!
This was a great fun event at the last Burn.  The presenter's been researching all year to find new tidbits and info to share.  (Hey, someone's gotta do the tough jobs.)  Come show off, learn stuff, and have fun.
title: BJ Practicum
print_description: Fellate your partner. Watch others. Ask questions. Share tips. Enjoy yourselves in this couples-only workshop on giving better head to men.

description:
The mission of the Black Rock Arts Foundation is to support and promote community, interactive art and civic participation.

The Black Rock Arts Foundation (BRAF) was founded by several of the partners who founded and produce Burning Man, an annual arts festival in the Nevada desert. The Burning Man event, like no other environment in the world, has created a unique venue for art, and has rekindled one of art’s most valuable functions: connecting community members in creation, curiosity, and wonderment. At Burning Man, we observe how art brings people together, inspires participation and engenders meaningful connections between individuals. The art experienced at Burning Man invites individuals to interact with both the work itself and with their community at large.

BRAF was established to bring this modality of creating and coexisting with art to the rest of the world, with the vision that community-driven, inclusive, and interactive art is vital to a thriving culture. The foundation received its 501(c)3 status in November of 2001. Come learn more and see how  you can get involved.
title: Black Rock Arts Foundation
print_description: The mission of the Black Rock Arts Foundation is to support and promote community, interactive art and civic participation.

Never fear dear sirens of the playa, Black Rock City Body & Paint is here to help.  Annually voted "Best Body Painters on the Playa", our playa Picassos will have your hooters well decorated for the big parade.  Sit back in a relaxing shaded area, sip on a nice glass of champagne or cabernet, and let our brilliant artisans weave their magic.  And after you are looking absolutely fabulous, wander over to Barbie's Day Spa for a massage or get your hair washed.  Black Rock City Body & Paint, a wholly owned subsidiary of Barbie Death Camp & Wine Bistro, wants your torso to be our canvas.  A splendid time is guaranteed for all.
title: Black Rock City Body & Paint is open for business
print_description: Your one-stop shop on the playa for the finest in breast and body painting prior to Critical Tits.  Our playa Picassos are here to help.

description:
10 reasons Burners and Mormons are a match made in heaven. 1) They both love temples, 2) settle in deserts, 3) build cities, and 4) are all about self sufficiency, 5) They love crazy ceremonies, 6) crazier visions, and 7) ornate pageants. 8) They both focus on the community, 9) spend liberally to support their cause, and 10) everyone agrees they're sooo nice. 

So let’s bring them together and see what happens. Mormons, former Mormons, and anyone intrigued by Mormonism are all welcome to come chat about Joseph Smith, Native American-Hebrew ancestry, your favorite broadway musical from the creators of South Park, or any other Mormon related topics. We'll be stocked with sparkling cider for the true believers, and champagne and beer for the rest.
title: Black Rock City Stake Mormon Mixer
print_description: Burners and Mormons are a match made in heaven: temples, deserts, city-building, visions. Come mingle and share a sparkling cider or ... beer.

description:
Black Rock Educators Consortium is an annual professional development opportunity that runs parallel to and in conjunction with the larger art festival in Black Rock City.

As educators, we all bring so much back to our classrooms from the playa. The goal of BREC is to create a staff development opportunity unlike any other- where we help each other to bring the magic home to our students. All educators are welcome; Early-childhood ed, K-12, higher ed, adult ed, certificated, classified, administrator or school board member, all are welcome! We all have something to share. 

Teach a breakout session! Collaborate on lesson plans! Bring home a slick flyer to share with your fellow educators!  Pick up a session listing and check out the break-out board! Can't make it to registration? Join us when you arrive.
title: Black Rock Educators Constortium
print_description: A unique staff development opportunity for early childhood, K-12, and adult educators.   Bring home an impressive conference schedule for your admins!

description:
Join Black Rock Solar at its annual event Solar Playa International. While sipping on a mint julep or ice cold beer, you will get a chance to meet the staff and crew of Black Rock Solar as well as other Burners doing meaningful and innovative work around the country.  The purpose of this event is to bring together all of the different groups and individuals on playa doing work in renewable energy, climate change, environmental outreach, and policy.  Tell us about your projects and learn about ours. 

Since 2007 Black Rock Solar has been building solar arrays in Nevada and giving them away at little or no cost, over 3 megawatts of clean renewable energy to date.  Black Rock Solar prioritizes installations for schools, hospitals, rural communities, non-profit groups, and Native American tribes.
title: Black Rock Solar’s Solar Playa International
print_description: Have a cold mint julep, learn about our projects, tell us what you’re doing in the world of renewable energy, climate change & environmental outreach.

All men are welcome at this non-denominational circle - initiated MKP brothers, as well as those with other (or no) men's work experience. description:
Calling all jocks, band geeks, sparkle ponies and shirt cockers*: Black Rock Yearbook is back to take your photo in your playa finery (or lack thereof) and memorialize you in its 2013 edition. While you’re waiting, sneak a sip of our spiked punch from the bar. (Remember, we do i.d.) But Blaine, what about prom? It’s Thursday night! Come join us from 8pm to 11pm to be photographed in your best prom dress, tuxedo, playa finery, or lack thereof. (See separate event listing.) If you’d like your art/mutant vehicle/theme camp photographed, email us at info@blackrockyearbook.com or find us on the playa. 
*with pants.

description: Ahhhh, what better way to fight hangovers or start your day drinking than with bacon, bloody marys, and good friends. Oh, the weather is nice? Why not take this repast on your favorite backyard patio? Gemini and her friends are all about dining al fresco and invite you their BRC patio to bring a cup and enjoy over five types of vodka bloody marys, a bloody maria, and even a virgin version for those designated drivers out there.There will also be BACON (duh?!) and bacon-infused, flavored, wrapped, and other goodies. Nothing virgin/vegetarian about the food. It's all salty, meaty, fatty goodness meant to complement the drinks and your appetite!We'll be open around 930am (you know, playa time)... and serve until we are bled dry for the day. Bawdy jokes encouraged (especially about meat, bleeding, and deliciousness), hugs always accepted, and kisses may be stolen.

description: Mystery and Beauty are biological epi-phenomena that intertwine to produce intellectual and spiritual aesthetics. The mystery and beauty of what I have termed "psychedelic rationalism" will be discussed using the lens of gender. This is a new way of thinking about women's participation and contributions to psychedelic culture, and introduces the idea of a blended rationalist paradigm of psychedelic knowledge. Far from essentialist assumptions that men are from Mars and women are from Venus, this talk will discuss the sociology of male/female cooperation, knowledge, experience, and community-building in psychedelic circles. What emerges is a new paradigm for understanding inner-action/interaction.
title: Blending the Mystery: Gender and Psychedelics
print_description: Chelsea Starr discusses women's participation and contributions to psychedelic culture, and introduces the idea of a blended rationalist paradigm.

description: Last year Earth Guardians volunteered to go out with BLM staff with GPS's and cameras to go out to specific spots in the city, checking for oil drips, grey water spills, black water spills and burn barrel problems.  BLM was checking for permit violations and we were along to help Burning Man with the documentation.  This year,  we'll be going out each morning with Friends of Black Rock volunteers as both LNT advisors and cultural ambassadors with BLM.  It's a great opportunity to have 'boots on the ground' and share LNT love.  Volunteers will all be getting lunch after each morning shift. (starting at 8:30am-noon).
title: BLM Compliance Team Training
print_description: This is a training for a volunteer shift to go out each morning with FBR as both LNT advisors and cultural ambassadors with BLM to share LNT love.

description:
Bobby Wheelock needs 32 volunteers to help deliver the Funpack flyers to every burning man participant. Deliver 2000 flyers and get much schwagg. -------

Yes,  Bobby Wheelock has finally worked out how to give back to every participant on the playa.  This will encompass delivering 64,000 unique flyers to everyone.  And we need YOU to help. --------

Upon taking this great privilege,  you will zig zag down the streets and give flyers to all participants - and these are not your normal flyers.  Each one is different, unique, and special.  There are jokes, puzzles, games, gags, and coupons, and ultimately a higher purpose - to make sure every burner gets the true value of decommodification.  These flyers are also very well organized so as to tell  participants everything they need to know - their new Playa name, color, home planet and more!
------
To participate,  Please wait at your most convenient corner on the outlying road of Laissez-faire on wednesday morning, and look for the mutant vehicle with a big Z on it. 
We will provide you with a bag full of a chunk of flyers, a map with directions, a official postal cap, and a second bag so you can collect all the gifts that are Deserved to you by the populace of Burning Man for your amazing volunteer effort.  The routes will be back and forth from each 1/2 hour street, moving inward from Laissez-faire to the Esplanade.
------
Help us with this amazing performance art project.  Help us ensure that Decommodification stays as a true principal!
------
Who is Bobby Wheelock?

Bobby is one of the earliest human clones.   Born in 1970,  he is duplicated from the DNA of a prominent German political leader.  That being said,  Bobby has veered away from his "father's" ways and wishes to bring love joy to the burning man community.
title: Bobby Wheelock Funpack delivery party
print_description: Bobby Wheelock needs 32 volunteers to help deliver the Funpack flyers to every burning man participant. Deliver 2000 flyers and get much schwagg

description:
The Body is Not an Apology is extending it's reach to Black Rock City in collaboration with Artisans Theatre Collective. This Body Acceptance Dance Party is a chance for all of us to let loose without feeling like we're being compared to the impossible commercial standards we face in the default world. Start the week off feeling fabulous about yourself with a playlist that includes Queen Latifah, Li'l Kim, Salt-N-Pepa, DJ Kool, Notorious BIG, A Tribe Called Quest and much more! Come and shake what your mama gave you and don't feel bad about it for one second. These are your people, you big beautiful burner!
There will be an art video/photo project being created, for posting on the internet after the event, which shows all of the variety of bodies we radically accept on the playa, not just the models that can make the director's cut for the "Places you'll go" video. Come and get your body painted as our artist sees fit and take a step to show off your radical self love!
There will be Sonoma County Sangria served at the Thirsty Camel bar and a multi-media dance extravaganza inside the dome. Special long distance appearance by performance poet and founder of TBINAA, Sonya Renee, via recorded audio and video.
title: Body Acceptance Dance Party
print_description:
Booty Bouncing Hip-Hop jams
Tuesday 8pm-12 midnight
illumelodie dome in Silicon Village
(6:00 & D)
Sonoma Sangria served
Photo/Video project

description:
Who is Jane Frum? Explore the gender binary in apocalyptic fiction and Cargo Cult. We'll discuss books like The Handmaid's Tale, Into the Forest, and favorites by Octavia Butler, Ursula Le Guin, and how they differ from ones by male authors like Cormac McCarthy, Philip K. Dick, and books like World War Z.
Beaverton Shade Structure, open to all.

description: OMG MUSIC WITH WORDS! Now in its eighth year on the playa, A Plus D bring BOOTIE BRC, the internationally-infamous mashup bootleg party, to Black Rock City! With guest DJs Lobsterdust, Entyme, Faroff, John!John!, Airsun, and more – along with mashup shows and performances throughout the night by  Alejandro and Adrian – Bootie BRC celebrates (and satirizes) pop culture both past and present, keeping your brain guessing and body dancing with creative song combinations. Mixing and matching every musical genre, era, and style into one big dance party, it's the soundtrack for the A.D.D. generation -- with free mashup CDs given away like candy! Launched in 2003 in San Francisco, Bootie was the first club night dedicated solely to the burgeoning artform of the bootleg mashup, and is now the biggest mashup event in the world, with regular parties in several cities on four continents. Bootie BRC is presented in part by the BRC Weekly, Black Rock City's independent newsweekly. Bootie ... because one song at a time just isn't enough.
title: Bootie BRC: AutoSub
print_description: OMG MUSIC WITH WORDS!! The greatest mashup party in the universe comes to BRC for its 8th year. DJs A Plus D and guests turn 2 songs into 1. Free CDs!

description: Love the art that you're experiencing on the playa? Wish you had art like this in your home town? Make it happen! Apply for a Black Rock Arts Foundation grant and create interactive art experiences in your community. The Black Rock Arts Foundation was founded in 2001, as a 501c3 non-profit, by several of the founding members of Burning Man. These founders wanted to fund like-minded, community-driven art experiences in the world. BRAF grants awards to about 10 grantees a year, ranging from $1000-$10,000 per project. BRAF's grants program has funded over 90 projects worldwide!Stop by the Everywhere Pavilion and talk to past grantees, members of the Grant Committee, and BRAF representatives who can answer all your questions about getting funding from BRAF. Get tips on proposal and budget writing. Come tell us about your great idea for an art project!
title: BRAF Grant Drop-In Q&A
print_description: BRAF grants fund interactive community-driven art off-playa. BRAF Board members and past grantees answer questions and explain the application process

hosted_by_camp.name: Black Rock City Transportation History Museum ("TranspHist")

description:
Did you know that Black Rock City used to have a stop on the transcontinental railroad?  That an extensive subway system once rolled beneath the Playa?  That at one time you could ride a streetcar from Gate to the Temple?

None of that is true!  But at the Black Rock City Museum of Transportation History, we explore the fictional story of fictional transportation in a fictional historical Black Rock City.  Learn about how burners got around the Playa before bikes ruled and art cars amazed.  See pictures, models, and artifacts gathered since Black Rock City's fictional founding nearly 150 years ago.  Hear from a guide, or if we're not around, take a self-guided tour.  Perhaps most importantly, tell us your own stories, or perhaps your grandmother's, about BRC's fictional transportation past!

We'll be open during the day (lunchtime to dinnertime) starting on Monday.  Our big gala takes place on Wednesday night at 9pm--it's Burner black tie.  Come find us on 9:00 near Desiderata!  Hope to see you.
title: BRC Museum of Transportation History's Annual Gala
print_description: Black Rock City Museum of Transportation History's  Annual Burner Black Tie Big Gala takes place on Wednesday night at 9pm at 9:00 near Desiderata!

description: The Black Rock City Philharmonic Orchestra seeks musicians to bring a performance of Beethoven's 7th Symphony to the playa.  Crazy, you say?  Impossible?  No more unlikely than a deaf composer.  -- To create the Black Rock City Philharmonic (a five-year project), we need: 1) section leaders in San Francisco, New York, Western Canada, and Eastern Canada; 2) a bank of Burn-ready instruments; 3) a network of veteran burners who are also skilled musicians; and 4) a road map to guide us to our performance, three or four years down the road. Musicians, enthusiasts, roadies, visionaries, and realists are all welcome to talk about how to bring Beethoven to the playa.  Join us for the inaugural meeting of the Black Rock City Philharmonic, to be held at the Golden Cafe in the French Quarter.
title: BRC Philharmonic Orchestra Annual Meeting
print_description: Musicians sought to bring a performance of Beethoven's 7th to the playa in 2017. More info at the annual meeting of the BRC Philharmonic Orchestra.

description:
Brewing beer on the playa? Can't be done. No way; not with 60 degree temperature swings, only one week for fermentation, hippie-quality sanitation, and pyromaniacs  stealing your flamethrowers when you're trying to boil the wort. We're going to do it anyways. On a camp stove, with a pot that's too small. By the end of the class, you'll have gone through the process; you'll know how to brew beer! Will you remember by the time you get home? Fat chance.

Barring disaster, it'll be fermented, carbonated, and kegged by the end of the week. Drinkable? We'll see.

21+ only
title: Brewing Beer on a Camp Stove
print_description: Brewing beer on the playa? Can't be done. We're going to do it anyways. On a camp stove, with a pot that's too small. Drinkable? We'll see. 21+ only

description:
It ain't like the spankings you got as a kid. This has RHYTHM! For those who do want a bit more zing in their play, come join us for a hands-on workshop. Come explore the experience of percussion being a source of erotic heat and arousal!
We'll talk about techniques and timing and psychology, about rhythm and drum sets - all with hands-on demonstrations and encouragement to explore on your own.  Where's the sweet spot?  How do you warm up?  Why bother to warm up?  How do you "read" the “drum”?
On the other side, how do you relax into being drummed?  Why would you want to?
Is it pain?  Is it pleasure?  Is it excitement? Is it music? Is there a difference?  Bring your own partner, or find one at the workshop, for a romp into this paradoxical, rhythmic world.
title: Bum Drumming
print_description: Round and smooth, bottoms make great drums.  But why stop with just one? Learn tips and practice your rhythms on a whole set of bum drums.

description: If you heard us last year, we know you smiled a lot. Get those endorphins flowing in others and in yourself as well by joining our motley crew for the fun of those olde songs. And if you just like to sing, stay tuned for our A Capella Chorus Jams on Wed and Fri from 4 to 5 PM. (See that entry, too!)

description:
For the 4th time, the Burning Man Ultramarathon will provide runners with fun, volunteers with stories, and everyone with a good old running time. Come on out, whether you want to run the entire thing, just part, pace a runner, or volunteer. The party starts at 5am - and lasts the whole day long. 

All runners will run 7-ish mile loops with 2-3 aid stations per loop. Bring a gallon of water and a running snack to share. Email cherylish at yahoo dot com. Or see the FB page too: https://www.facebook.com/events/193693464096129/?fref=ts
title: Burning Man Ultramarathon
print_description: Who doesn't want to run 50 kilometers in the funnest place on the planet? Bring a water bottle and get ready for the ultimate high - runner's high!

description:
Was John Frum a racist? Is the current theme of BM ignoring the dangers of colonialism, power, and privilege? 
Explore the ways race, class, gender, power, and privilege affect your experience on and off playa.

This workshop is a challenge to the theme that Cargo Cult is all about aliens, visitors returning, and celebrating John Frum. Come join in an interactive workshop that will explore the shadow side of John Frum including the negative impact of colonialism, the glorification of material objects, the destruction of native lands and culture, America's lack of responsibility for military endeavors, and the current impact of this Cargo Cult story. This workshop will explore our shared reality of how racism, classism, and sexism affect our current Burning Man community. We welcome people of all backgrounds to this workshop and to this exploration of how the oppression we were taught in every day society plays out on playa. We will explore the difficulties of the current paradigm and how that affects our ability to form a new experimental community. There will be space to address how we as the BM community want to create change on and off playa.
title: Cargo Cult or Celebration of Colonialism?
print_description: Was John Frum a racist? Is Cargo Cult about colonialism, power, and privilege? Explore how race, class, gender,& privilege affect your BM experience.

description: Cartooning is a powerful art-form that can entertain and influence, but is simple to learn and accessible to all.  Come learn from a professional cartoonist to practice this expressive and enjoyable skill. All skill levels welcome; you do not need to have any prior training or experience. Learn all the basic skills like character creation, layout, composition, perspective, and comedy writing. Brush up on advanced techniques like human and animal figure drawing, proportion, and color. We end with an improvisational art game using the cartooning skills we've learned. Supplies provided, or bring your own.
title: Cartoon Workshop
print_description: Anyone can cartoon! Come learn and practice this expressive, enjoyable skill. All levels welcome. Basic & advanced techniques of a powerful art form.

description:
special CEC-BR celebrate edition.  60 min sit to conjure up the spirit of parties past, future, and roll them into one hella day party present.

sure a bloody mary at 8 might wake you up, but that shit be temporary.  wake up for good, and for always.  see into the source of all things, and realize that you are it, always were, ain't no effort to flow in the river of the present moment, and let it dance you. C.E.C. - Black Rock offers 15 minutes instruction on a basic mindfulness technique, shinzen young style,  followed by a 40 minute guided meditation.  meditate, celebrate, elevate: these are the trinity of the CEC.  the meditation gets you clear, the celebrate gets you fire, and the elevate brings you up where there's no coming down.    bring a yoga mat 30 minutes early for a pre-sit stretch.  bring your own cushion.  bring your own illusion, and watch it fall. until all loving things are saved from stifling, faithfully yours, secretary of secretaries.
title: CEC - BRC meditation *special celebrate edition
print_description: special CEC-BR celebrate edition.  60 min sit to conjure up the spirit of parties past, future, and roll them into one hella day party present.

description: The Celestial Fusion Communicator will be erected in front of our lounge, ready to call out to the Heavenly Ones for more inter-galactic gifts.  As an assemblage of gongs, drums, bells and chimes cobbled together from recycled instruments and modern found objects, the Communicator will be available to all comers for their radical musical self-expression.  Demandingly loud or sweetly plaintive, rhythms and unique sonic punctuations will fly to the cosmos as prayers and petitions, reinforced at night with beams of light.  The Communicator will invite impromptu solo performances as well as many-handed jam sessions, and will be a focal point of our camp's Thursday afternoon party.  (We'll take away the drumsticks late at night.)

description: The Chakraland game is a 22×30 foot vinyl flooring of a multicolored human sized game that participants play by rolling the giant dice and moving towards the different colored squares, each square representing a different chakra. The layout is similar to the child’s game “Candyland”. The squares will all have different quests written on them that need to be completed in a certain timeframe, or players have to go back to the previous square of the same color. There are some short cuts, wild pink squares, and black lose-a-turn squares. The winner makes it to the end of the colored path and gets loved up by the colorful game jesters.
title: Chakraland Game!
print_description: Come play the adult size version of Candyland...but we call it Chakraland! Roll the dice & the game jesters will egg you on to the finish line, yay!

description:
"Since the meme of money is a pervasive control structure in global society, changing money will fundamentally change our experience and actions taken within our collective reality.
This experience is relevant to all.  


Participants will come to intimately understand how changing their personal 'money meme' will change reality.
The 'where' is everywhere, again since money is so pervasive.  That Burning Man is a 'gifting society' is a dodge.  It exists within a moneyed society, and only at the considerable expenditure of vast sums of money, energy and materials.  


The 'when' is similarly pervasive.  The experience will change participants forever, and in so doing help create a paradigm shift by which humanity MAY survive the onset of ecological breakdown that scientists indicate has already begun with the 'anthropocine extinction episode' currently afoot."
title: Changing Reality By Changing Money
print_description: "Since the meme of money is a pervasive control structure in global society, changing money will fundamentally change our experience and actions

Projection of Mister WA's Documentary- in-Progress on the Sails of the NARWHAL moored across from the Playa Queen Regional Effigy (CORE).

Through the lens of The Cockettes’ heritage, Mister WA explores the free-spirited and radically inclusive performance traditions unique to the Bay Area. This organically-developed documentary investigates the current resurgence of glam gender and theatre of the ridiculous while weaving a vibrant tapestry of music and performance stretching from San Francisco to Black Rock City.

Brooklyn’s own DJ Wonderfunk brings her unique blend of funk, hip out, and r&b to twist out a rump jump’n set worthy of Coney Island.

And what’s Coney Island without a little circus fare? Calling all jugglers, hoopers, and circus prop manipulators of any stripe. Show us your skills, or just come and dance like the sideshow freaks you always wanted to be.

description:
YOU ALWAYS WANTED TO RUN OFF AND JOIN THE CIRCUS...

NOW YOU CAN!

Come earn your clown nose at Circus Boot Camp. You've seen feats of skill on the Playa, and who hasn't dreamed of running off to join the Circus. Heck, half of y'all probably still dream in acrobats and clowns.  At Circus Boot Camp, we'll teach you to juggle, unicycle, hoop, slack line, trapeze, crack a whip and indulge your childish fancy in other circus-inspired arts.

I know what you're thinking: "Sure, you'll teach me to juggle... after I've spent years on the road washing elephants and dodging monkey poop!" Wrong! Our goal is nothing less than to bring the joys of object manipulation, unicycling and other circus arts to the Playa masses in a casual, friendly and fully clothed environment (ok, mostly-clothed).

Already a circus pro? Come test your mettle on our slackline; dance your clown shoes through the obstacles of irony; pass clubs with seasoned semi-professionals; try your hand at the Valley of One-Wheeled Doom!!
title: Circus Play Time!
print_description: Juggle balls/clubs/fire; unicycle; crack whips; slackline; aerial silks/rope; hooping; cyr wheel & more!  Beginners and experts welcome!

description:
The Tetrion Spaceport

A very long time ago, Aliens came to this planet and built a spaceport. They brought in spaceships with supplies, did a little bit of genetic engineering and started what we know as modern civilization. Then they left without a trace. Without its force field, the spaceport reverted to basic elements. In other words, it dissolved.

The ancient people of that time did everything to try to call back the aliens and their spaceships. They built spaceports, called henges out of wood, to no avail. They even built a spaceport out of stone. Its remains can be found in Southern England and is known today as Stonehenge. Still no Aliens came. They were missing the technology they did not understand.

Well, we have figured it out. They were missing a beacon. Without a Quantum Transducer acting as a subspace beacon the alien spaceships have nothing to home in on. Well, we have fixed that. We built one. In fact, the entire spaceport is one giant beacon, shining like a lighthouse in the subspace frequencies.

At 11:00 p.m. on Wednesday night, we will turn on our subspace Quantum Transducer. A spaceship will appear and Johnfrum will return to Earth. He will bring us a message of peace and friendship. He will once again return to Earth and live with us in harmony.

We will welcome him with wine, women, music and dance. So be at Camp Tetrion and its Spaceport for the festivities. This will be the real deal! Rejoice! Johnfrum will come back at long last!
title: Close Encounter
print_description: Johnfrum will return from Alpha Centauri. He will teleport from a Flying Saucer into the Tetrion Spaceport. He will speak to you. You will listen!!

description: CODAME on The Playa is an Art+Tech celebration that reaches out to the creative developer community on The Playa. Our mission is to bring together artists, technologists, and designers that push the boundaries of hardware, software, and physical/digital mediums for one evening to play and share. Our ultimate goal is to leave our participants and audience with one of the most unique Art+Tech experiences. In the end we would love to see a seed of inspiration taking bloom in someone’s eyes and diffusing creative digital glow through their entire spirit. If you think you've got that special sparkle in you to inspire others, looking for the ways to get  inspired, or just want to play and hang around with like-minded people, join us on Tuesday, the 29th, after dusk at our camp Clusterf*uck United for the dimension of " code" me on The Playa experience.

description:
Participants play games to experience how using different kinds of money quickly changes how we relate to each other, followed by discussion & talk.

This experiential workshop aims to make us aware of the subtle impacts the money we use have on us, and that it need not be this way. Besides having fun playing games, we will also be debriefing the experience to deepen the learning, hear a short lecture about different kinds of complementary currencies, and learn about one that is operating in the Bay Area.

if there's one thing we know about, it's partying. if there's two, it's meditating. on partying. once you get that hook, it's so many win's in a row, like winwinwin winwinwinwinwinwin, basically you can die without ever losing even once. 

get lost. get found. CEC-Black Rock pre-party sit at 11 am then a boozy day party full of rubadubrocka break beats and soulful future shiiit. Join the Secretary of Secretaries, Babs attack, Debbie K, ms mireille as they save your ass from sitting, in fact, you might as well kiss it goodbye.

Dress? Explorer. Native. Cult. 

Yes, the pith helmet looks good – it looks very good, as does your wild and bushy moustache, which cannot be tamed. For the women we imagine a hemp petticoat, 10-hole combat boots, and “Indra’s fishnet” stockings (tiny blinking jewel at each textile intersection). we know you got soul. How? It glints from behind your eyes, beams from your beautiful face, so save yourself.  Elevate. Celebrate so you can activate. sure a bloody mary at 8 might wake you up, but that shit be temporary.  wake up for good, and for always.  see into the source of all things, and realize that you are it, always were, ain't no effort to flow in the river of the present moment, let it dance you. C.E.C. - Black Rock offers 15 minutes instruction on a basic mindfulness technique, shinzen young style, followed by a 40 minute guided meditation.  meditate, celebrate, activate: these are the trinity of the CEC.  the meditation gets you clear, the celebrate gives you juice, and the elevate brings you up where there's no coming down.  bring a yoga mat 30 minutes early for a pre-sit stretch.  bring your own cushion.  bring your own illusion, and watch it fall. 

until all loving things are saved from stifling, faithfully yours, secretary of secretaries, dr james.

description: Contradancing all levels every night to live music - looped/ traditional/ celtic/ fusion/ techno; fast-paced yet easy to learn with a caller who instructs (but with room for dancers to improvise). Half the moves are with your partner, half with everyone else - so it has a tribal vibe, where the Zen is flow, synchrony, and bonding (not footwork, not competition). The repeated cycles of movement give dancers a long time to catch on.  In any case if you are smiling you are doing it right.  Dancers adjust their behavior to each new dancer they come to and gently realign fellow dancers if needed making contradancing one of the most accessible group dance forms, with for example mentally disabled, blind, deaf and wheelchair bound dancers at many dances.  Friendly to children and adults carrying children.  Sunset - midnightish (later if everyone keeps going), except Sat starts 30 min after the man falls, Sun starts 60 min after the temple burn begins.  Go to website to 'taste' dancing (including headcam video) and music.
title: Contradancing to live music

description:
We are thrilled to announce the third annual Circle of Regional Effigies (CORE) comprised of wooden sculptures created by Burning Man Regional groups from around the world! This year's configuration will see 4 circles of six effigies placed around the base of the Man that will burn together on Thursday night at exactly 9pm to create the world's largest intentional simultaneous Burn!

Guided by the Ten Principles, CORE teams work together throughout the Spring and Summer to create art that celebrates their Regional identities and showcases the collaborative artistic efforts of their community members. The CORE Project is a celebration of Burning Man's Regional Network and of the work that groups throughout the world are doing to nurture and support the Burning Man ethos as a global cultural movement.

2013's Circle of Regional Effigies will include the highest number of international Regional groups to date with groups from Taiwan, Israel, The Netherlands, Lithuania, Czech Republic, and France joining the circle.
If you are joining us on the playa, visit the Everywhere Pavilion on the Esplanade to get placement maps, and read more info about each effigy, meet with Regional Contacts and CORE artists and collaborators.
In the meantime, please read about the pieces on the Burning Man website, so you can understand them better, and enjoy them that much more during your time in BRC.

•••Tour de CORE Monday 7-10pm•••
There will be a TOUR DE CORE Celebration of the Regional Effigies on Monday evening. This is the time to come out to the CORE project and visit with the creators and builders and see what they have to share with you about their projects. This is Black Rock City's moment to honor these groups for their exceptional work!

•••LINKS•••
CORE Burn: bit.ly/COREBurn2013
Tour de CORE: bit.ly/TourdeCORE2013
Stay updated on all things CORE: facebook.com/BurningManCORE
Read up on the 2013 CORE Projects: burningman.com/installations/art_core.html
title: CORE Burn - Circle of Regional Effigies
print_description: Witness the World's Largest Coordinated Burn! All 24 pieces ignite in unison at exactly 9pm. Visit the Everywhere Pavilion for full info and maps.
other_location: Circle of Regional Effigies around The Man

description: Invented in the late 1800's, the cloud chamber is a small aquarium sized tool used for observing the trails left behind as charged particles from the cosmos shower on to the earth. This is the device that sparked the fire of modern experimental particle physics by allowing the pioneers of the science to provide evidence for the existence of particles that resulted from nuclear decay processes. The particles from the cosmos above shower the playa every second of every day and now you too can see them with your naked eye. Bring your cameras and try and snag a shot to take back with you!
title: Cosmic Cloud Chamber
print_description: Protons, electrons and muons, oh my! Particles from the cosmos above shower the playa every second and now you too can see them with your naked eye.

description:
Calling all students, staff, faculty, alumni, and friends of California Institute of Integral Studies! As classes begin back home in San Francisco, we know there are many of us right here in Black Rock City. Instead of meeting in the halls to talk about how "great the burn was this year," and how “we should meet up next year,” let's get together on the Playa to celebrate our amazing community and the unique institution that we call home. PCC Professor Richard Tarnas will give an enlightening talk on the historical role of “heroic communities” in transforming the world (like CIIS and Burning Man). Wear your best Playa fashions, bring your friends and family, and maybe even get some ideas for your next academic paper. Let’s elevate “school spirit” to a new dimension while we enjoy each other outside of our default roles. We’ll have some drinks, we’ll have some laughs, and we’ll dance with reckless abandon as we get ready to transform the (default) world.

COSMOCPOIA [address]
Tuesday, August 27, 8PM
title: Cosmocopia CIIS Community Mixer w/ Richard Tarnas
print_description: Gather with students, faculty, staff, alumni & friends of the California Institute of Integral Studies to share stories, ideas, & cocktails.

description: Are you ready for an open relationship but don’t know where to begin? Is your partner unsure or skeptical? Are you eager to open your relationship, but afraid all you will do is open Pandora’s box? The good news is we humans are not as innately monogamous as society would have us believe, and bug eyed jealousy is not a beast you have to live with. Peter and Gretchen will open their hearts (as well as their relationship) to participants, sharing their insights, experiences, ups and downs. Everything is on the table as we help you crack the door to a loving open relationship.

description:
Shonagh Home, author of 'Love and Spirit Medicine,' will discuss her encounters with a group of intelligences that have presented themselves to her through her shamanic work with the sacred mushroom.
 
Bio:
Author, shaman and spell breaker, Shonagh Home takes her students beyond the cultural mass-trance and into the territory of the sacred. She works with both individuals and groups to foster new paradigms and awaken self-healing. Through her writing, she shares mystery teachings about the magic of the body, the reclaiming of ourselves as True Human Beings, and our ability to engage with the technology of nature. She teaches workshops that are deeply transformative, helping people to release from old behavior patterns and access a wealth of inner resources. She teaches in the Pacific Northwest and around the country. You can learn more about Shonagh by visiting her website at
www.shonaghhome.com
title: Cultivating Relationship with Plant Spirit Allies
print_description: Shonagh Home will discuss her encounters with intelligences that have presented themselves to her through her shamanic work with the sacred mushroom.

description: A Dancing Freedom movement exploration to music. Where do we find the courage to face the present and the nourishment to embrace the future? In movement and dance we can find surrender, and surrender, by nature, is a fearless state. Courage also is a fearless state. Courage and surrender are united in the present. Find the courage to go where you are going by exploring where you are here and now.

description: Dark Sparkle is the potent mix of the mysterious and the dangerous that makes something irresistibly attractive. It's what pushes people to the point of insanity; that unexplainable quality that pulls people to the dark side. Some days, Dark Sparkle is your alter-ego; other days it is your most natural feeling form. Dark Sparkle is Mona Lisa's smile, biscuits and gravy, the Fonz, the apocalypse. It is an adventurous way of life--physically, emotionally and mentally that citizens of BRC embrace. Our shows are an opportunity for Dark Sparklers and other BRC citizens to explore and showcase their Dark Sparkle through performance, storytelling, and tease. Featuring your favorite DS performers as well as guests from the BRC community. We'll also turn the tables with ample opportunity for participation.

description:
Sensatron (pyramid time machine with dancing light meters) will be DJing ROBOT dance parties in Deep Playa at dawn on days containing the letter R.

Inviting animators, pop-lockers, wavers, mimes, spinners, robots etc. Event will serve as a workshop for robot dancing techniques such as animating,  gliding, body movement isolation and creating space. 

Anticipated are photo opportunities with silhouettes and golden light upon animated people. Drones are welcome. 

The Sensatron is an art car that parks at camp "Post Nuclear Family" (4:45 and D) Meet at 4:20 am to ensure finding us.  When observed in Deep Playa, the "Sensatron"(look it up), will appear well lit at night with 12 light strands forming a field above a furry purple pyramid.  The light strands will be dancing to the sound which will be hydraulic gear grinding electronic base droppings (bring your mp3 player). 

The daytime will reveal Sensatrons rainbow crown of flags and a victory for the machines...

description:
Thursday night - "DC not Washington presents Vaudeville not Dinner Theater."

Burlesque, boylesque, belly dancing, pole dancing, hula hooping, silks, comedy, music, drag, and more. This is the DC that you don't see in on the world news — this is DC NOT Washington! DC is a melting pot of diversity and creativity where performance artists from around the world thrive. Come experience our wild side — DC at its best. Just like city itself, our cast includes international and local performers alike. (In that spirit, if you'd like to join our growing and evolving cast on stage, email StuLamour@gmail.com).

description:

description:
We would like to invite you to POSE NUDE in a group photographic installation by artist Spencer Tunick.

Spencer will choose men, women and any gender identity to be part of this unique installation.

In order to be chosen we ask that you please send in a low resolution photograph of yourself.
Participants will be selected based on photographs submitted to the email: 
projects@spencertunick.com
Please send the image sooner rather than later.

Most installations by Spencer do not have limits to the number of people participating, nor do they require the submission of a photograph. However, for this art work for Burning Man, there is a cap on the number of people participating due to the specific concept of the work.
We are asking for a photograph because we want to have a wide range of body types and skin tonalities represented in the final work. Although everyone is unique, If you are not chosen, it is simply because we may have reached the amount of people with similar specific characteristics. We apologize in advance if you are not chosen for this particular idea but please do not let it deter you from posing in future works by Spencer where there are no number limits.

Chosen participants will be contacted by email prior to August 24th with: location and further instructions. Please only sign up if you are committed to participating and able to wake up before sunrise (or stay up all night). The work will take place before sunrise in order to utilize the pre-dawn light. You will be in position when the sun rises.

You only will be nude for a short period of time. 
...we know it's chilly...so you will not be nude until right before the sun rises over the horizon and as the sun hits your body. 5am is just the call time to get you registered.  We need everyone to be on time.  In exchange for taking part, you will receive by mail, a limited edition print of the art work. PARTICIPANTS ONLY. 
Thank-you!
title: Desert Spirits by Spencer Tunick
print_description: POSE NUDE in Spencer's new installation. Desert Spirits will greet the sunrise on Friday morning. Space limited. Participants only. spencertunick.com

description: John Frum may not have yet returned, but Dex Mex has! It all began five years ago.  Our exhausted, dusty bodies were too tired to traipse across the across the playa to dance to our home-grown DJ, Dex Stakker.  Invite DJ to play, add tequila = Dex Mex!  Dex Mex (¡Olé!) has since grown to include world-class DJ talent and has been heralded by many as “the best daytime party on the playa”. Sure, that could have been the tequila talking, but tequila knows a good party, so you should listen when it speaks. So bring a cup, your tinfoil sombrero, and your anti-gravity dancing shoes and join the conga line from camp (8:45 & C) out to the party on the playa.

description:
So you need a thing…
A primer on digital fabrication.  i.e. Getting stuff made with digital tools.
This is a short lecture and longer discussion group on making things with:  CNC routers and mills, Laser cutters/engravers.  Also touching on water jet, plasma tables, and 3D printers.  
Facilitated by Shoeshine, an instructor at San Diego’s premier group shop – Makerplace.
Topics include:  Design software and file formats, 2D vs. 2.5D vs. true 3D,  materials, design and strategy  for digital production,  different processes  -  pros and cons of each, ways of learning the tools, finding access, online and 3rd party resources, bridging the gap between art and manufacturing, and whatever else the collective mind wants to delve into.
Note:  This is aimed at folk who would like to make use of these incredible technologies but don’t know where to begin.  Though experienced users/makers are welcomed and encouraged to come and add to the discussion.
Loads of examples to view, handle, and talk about … Q&A session to follow… and schwag!!!
title: DIY Digital Fabrication
print_description: Primer: CNC, lasers, 3D, others. Software, finding access. Where to begin? This is for you. Veteran makers welcome. Lots of examples

description:
Welcome Bakers, Builders and Hi Gluten Fans!

In the Black Rock City tradition of emergency and experimental shelter, the world’s first building made of 805 bread loaf bricks is being constructed at the Skinny Kitty Tea Lounge camp. ( please fill in location as we have not been assigned a space yet)

We finally found a solid use for white bread; it’s the perfect building block. If you’ve ever wondered about the compressive strength of a 10 day old loaf, make a point to come by and marvel at this free-standing enclosed structure. The material for this abode can be grown in one growing season and has an insulation value of R-5. The inspiration for this 10 foot diameter Dome of Dough is the traditional beehive shape of the charcoal kilns in Death Valley.

Crawl inside, wonder at the meditative vibe and who knows, maybe there will be fresh bread and jam for snacking.

WARNING: HI Gluten Zone!

description:
Just like the Amazing Race, but with a costumed twist! At about 5pm, you and a partner will pair up to race against other teams in a scavenger hunt around the playa. The goal is to make it to every “pit stop”, add each pit stop’s “costume piece”, complete each “pit stop” challenge, and make it back to Drag on Dragon camp for Drag Yourself to the Playa Prom. The first five teams to make it back to Drag on Dragon in full costume and successfully completing each pit stop will automatically be on Playa Prom Court! Please bring a purse/backpack/bag so when you costume change, you won’t leave moop. *Specific rules will be posted at Drag on Dragon and explained before the burn.
Check us out at:
https://www.facebook.com/groups/burndragondragon/

description:
Awaken your life force using simple techniques that integrate tapping, moving, and breathing. Wisdom in the language of movement. Neolithic shamanism.   All are welcome, especially beginners.
•	Come join us for a light heart-ed exploration of Qigong, an ancient book of wisdom written in the language of movement.  You'll discover that you have all the resources you need to keep your body healthy and your mind at peace, using these simple, yet profound movements.  Jump, tap, shake, sway, and breath yourself into a state of tranquility & health.  There will be an emphasis on practical application; this is a workshop and ritual, not a lecture! All are welcome, especially beginners.  Open yourself to the magic coursing within. Qigong is much gentler than most forms of yoga, and a wonderful complement to a vigorous yoga practice. Both practices have a common source, Neolithic shamanism.
title: Dragon Gate Qigong
print_description: Awaken your life force using simple techniques that integrate tapping, moving, and breathing. Wisdom in the language of movement. Neolithic shamanism.

description:
Participation on the playa for over a decade, transforming metal into art is our practice and our passion. This year, at Cargo Cult 2013, we’ve again brought this process of transformation to the Playa to share our burning passion with YOU! The Dragon Smelter is both a kinetic sculpture and a real reduction foundry. Working with the general LNT effort at Burning Man we will perform a live casting event melting cans and scrap aluminum, participant donated moop is transformed into molten aluminum and poured into both predesigned and on playa burner-designed sand molds. 

Nightly fire effects are held at the dragon belching flames 15 feet into the air! 

Please also find us at Recycle camp, where our collaboration with the LNT initiative invites us to set up our coin press. We invite you to come press your very own Flying saucer inspired Cargo Cult 2013 recycled aluminum coins.
title: Dragon Smelter Metal Foundry
print_description: Visit the Dragon 100 yrds off the Esplanade at 7:30. Roaring Nightly fire effects, Aluminum Castings, and Press your very own Al coin at Recycle Camp!

description: Instead of schlepping your emotional baggage around the playa, come leave it with us! We are the Emotional Cargo Holding Office and we're here to help relieve you of your burdens. We'll let you talk through it, write it down, or both - and then you can just put it on file with us (by last name).  If you want us to mail it to you, of course we can (since we are part and partner of the PO9).  If you want us to have it burned with the Temple, we'll take it out there to the Temple Guardians (another of our strategic partners).  We will do our best to do whatever our customer desires - the important thing is that we send you back out on the playa with far less emotional cargo. We plan to be open from 12-5 each day with possible additional hours in the evenings.
title: ECHO Chamber
print_description: Come leave your emotional baggage at the Emotional Cargo Holding Office so you don't have to schlep it around the playa with you all week.
